name: Mohawk Indian Corn Soup
author: Mohawk
summary: On the Akwesasne Reservation where I grew up I have fond memories of corn soup always being on the stove on New Year's Eve. Friends and family would stop in and have a bowl or two and celebrate the end of the year. I continue this tradition with my own family now. Use canned Indian corn instead of hominy if available.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
1 ¾ pounds pork loin fillet, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir pork in hot oil until browned on all sides, 5 to 10 minutes
Stir water, beef bouillon, and chicken bouillon together in a large pot over medium-high heat until bouillon dissolves
Add pork, rutabaga, carrots, and celery; bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until vegetables tender, about 40 minutes
Stir hominy and kidney beans into pork-vegetable mixture and simmer until hominy and meat are tender, about 30 minutes more
Season with salt and ground black pepper
